abstract.p: Group of four freelance writers file suit in Federal District Court in San Francisco against three online database operators; suit asserts that Northern Light Technology, Gale Group and Bell & Howell Information and Learning compiled databases of copyrighted materials, then resold works over Internet without reimbursing authors (S)

block.p: Taking a cue from the recording industry lawsuit against Napster, freelance writers have turned to the courtroom to fight what they assert is Internet-based piracy of their works. A group of four freelance writers filed a lawsuit in Federal District Court in San Francisco on Monday against three online database operators. The suit asserts that Northern Light Technology, Gale Group and Bell & Howell Information and Learning compiled databases of copyrighted materials, then resold works over the Internet without reimbursing authors. Lawyers for the four plaintiffs hope to qualify the complaint as a class-action suit.
